Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\teddy.layani\\eclipse-workspace\\oricode-poc" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix pill button state persistence in Eclipse using localStorage

Problem: Pill button state was not persisting across setText\(\) calls because
the _answeredPills Set was declared inside the HTML string that gets replaced.

Solution: Migrate from in-memory Set to localStorage-based persistence with
three helper functions:
- getAnsweredPills\(\) - Read from localStorage
- addAnsweredPill\(pillId\) - Add to localStorage
- isAnsweredPill\(pillId\) - Check if pill was answered

Changes:
- Replaced var _answeredPills = new Set\(\) with localStorage functions
- Updated selectPillOption\(\) to use isAnsweredPill\(\) and addAnsweredPill\(\)
- Updated submitCustomPillResponse\(\) to use isAnsweredPill\(\) and addAnsweredPill\(\)
- Updated restorePillStates\(\) to use getAnsweredPills\(\)

Benefits:
- State now survives setText\(\) calls
- State persists across Eclipse restarts
- VS Code compatibility maintained \(localStorage is standard browser API\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\teddy.layani\\eclipse-workspace\\oricode-poc" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''

\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\teddy.layani\\eclipse-workspace\\oricode-backend" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Increase max_tokens from 4096 to 8192 for larger responses

Problem: AI was stopping mid-response when generating long explanations
or code. The 4096 token limit was too restrictive, causing truncation
before completing the response or proposing next steps \(pill buttons\).

Evidence from logs \(2026-01-21 10:49\):
- Response was 13,192 characters \(~3,500+ tokens\)
- AI stopped mid-explanation without proposing pill buttons
- No completion markers, just finalized message

Solution: Increase max_tokens to 8192 \(2x increase\)

Why 8192:
- Sweet spot for Claude Sonnet 4 cost/performance
- Allows for:
  * Long explanations with context
  * Multiple tool calls with results
  * Code generation with chunking instructions
  * Error diagnostics with solutions
  * Pill button proposals with options
- Still reasonable for API costs

Applies to both endpoints:
- POST /api/chat \(main chat endpoint\)
- POST /api/chat/continue \(continuation endpoint\)

Note: For ABAP code deployments > 15K chars, chunking workflow
\(mcp_store_code_chunk\) is still used as documented in system prompt.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\teddy.layani\\eclipse-workspace\\oricode-website" commit -m "Update session summary with max_tokens fix and pill state success")

EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\teddy.layani\\eclipse-workspace\\oricode-backend" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
CRITICAL: Reduce chunk size from 15K to 8K and send ONE chunk per message

Problem: With 15K char chunks, Claude was hitting the 8192 token response
limit while trying to include the code_chunk parameter in the tool call,
resulting in:
[CHUNK_MISSING_CODE] Claude sent chunk without code_chunk parameter!

Evidence from logs \(11:21:08\):
- Chunk 1/4 stored successfully with 17,415 chars
- Chunk 2/4 sent WITHOUT code_chunk \(truncated during tool call generation\)
- Same pattern repeating for all subsequent chunks

Root Cause Analysis:
- 8192 max_tokens = ~6K characters of output capacity
- 15K char chunks + tool call JSON + explanatory text > 8K token limit
- Claude generates tool call structure but truncates code_chunk content
- Result: Tool call sent with metadata but NO actual code

Solution: Reduce chunk size to 8K chars and send ONE chunk per message

Changes:
1. Chunk size: 15K → 8K characters
2. Threshold: 15K → 10K \(when to start chunking\)
3. Messages: 1-2 chunks per message → ONLY 1 chunk per message
4. Example updated: 90K code = 12 chunks = 12 separate messages + 1 deploy

Why 8K chunks work:
- 8K chars ≈ 2K tokens \(4:1 ratio for code\)
- Tool call overhead ≈ 200 tokens
- Explanation text ≈ 500 tokens
- Total: ~2.7K tokens < 8192 limit ✓

Example for 90K code:
- Old: 90K / 15K = 6 chunks \(each too large, causes truncation\)
- New: 90K / 8K = 12 chunks \(each fits in response\)
- Send 12 separate messages \(one chunk each\) + final deploy message

User feedback: "90000 chars 30000 lines of code" - real-world use case

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
